nats.client

Interface Nats

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface Nats
extends Closeable
    Provides the interface for publishing messages and subscribing to NATS subjects. This class is responsible for maintaining a connection to the NATS server as well as automatic fail-over to a second server if the connection to one server fails.

    This class is fully thread-safe.

    Author:
    Mike Heath

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this Nats instance. Closes the connection to the Nats server, closes any subscriptions, cancels any pending messages to be published.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:

      • publish

        Publication publish(String subject)
        Publishes an empty message to the specified subject. If this Nats instance is not currently connected to a Nats server, the message will be queued up to be published once a connection is established.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish to
        Returns:
        a Publication object representing the pending publish operation.

      • subscribe

        Subscription subscribe(String subject,
                     String queueGroup)
        Subscribes to the specified subject within a specific queue group. The subject can be a specific subject or include wild cards. A message to a particular subject will be delivered to only member of the same queue group.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to subscribe to
        queueGroup - the queue group the subscription participates in
        Returns:
        a Subscription object used for interacting with the subscription
        See Also:
        subscribe(String, String, Integer)

      • subscribe

        Subscription subscribe(String subject,
                     Integer maxMessages)
        Subscribes to the specified subject and will automatically unsubscribe after the specified number of messages arrives.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to subscribe to
        maxMessages - the number of messages this subscription will receive before automatically closing the subscription.
        Returns:
        a Subscription object used for interacting with the subscription
        See Also:
        subscribe(String, String, Integer)

      • subscribe

        Subscription subscribe(String subject,
                     String queueGroup,
                     Integer maxMessages)
        Subscribes to the specified subject within a specific queue group and will automatically unsubscribe after the specified number of messages arrives.

        The subject may contain wild cards. "*" matches any token, at any level of the subject. For example: 

             "foo.*.baz"  matches "foo.bar.baz, foo.a.baz, etc.
     "*.bar" matches "foo.bar", "baz.bar", etc.
     "*.bar.*" matches "foo.bar.baz", "foo.bar.foo", etc.

        ">" matches any length of the tail of a subject and can only be the last token. For examples, 'foo.>' will match 'foo.bar', 'foo.bar.baz', 'foo.foo.bar.bax.22'. A subject of simply ">" will match all messages.

        All subscriptions with the same queueGroup will form a queue group. Each message will be delivered to only one subscriber per queue group.

        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to subscribe to
        queueGroup - the queue group the subscription participates in
        maxMessages - the number of messages this subscription will receive before automatically closing the subscription.
        Returns:
        a Subscription object used for interacting with the subscription

      • request

        Request request(String subject,
              String message,
              MessageHandler... messageHandlers)
        Sends a request message on the given subject. Request responses can be handled using the returned Request.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to send the request on
        message - the content of the request
        messageHandlers - there is small chance that the request reply will arrive before a message handler is attached to the requests publication, so you can optionally add a message handler here.
        Returns:
        a Request instance associated with the request.
        See Also:
        request(String, String, Integer, MessageHandler...)

      • request

        Request request(String subject,
              MessageHandler... messageHandlers)
        Sends a request on the given subject with an empty message. Request responses can be handled using the returned Request.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to send the request on
        messageHandlers - there is small chance that the request reply will arrive before a message handler is attached to the requests publication, so you can optionally add a message handler here.
        Returns:
        a Request instance associated with the request.
        See Also:
        request(String, String, Integer, MessageHandler...)

      • request

        Request request(String subject,
              String message,
              Integer maxReplies,
              MessageHandler... messageHandlers)
        Sends a request message on the given subject. Request responses can be handled using the returned Request. Invoking this method is roughly equivalent to the following: String replyTo = Nats.createInbox(); Subscription subscription = nats.subscribe(replyTo, maxReplies); Publication publication = nats.publish(subject, message, replyTo); that returns a combination of Subscription and Publication as a Request object.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to send the request on
        message - the content of the request
        maxReplies - the maximum number of replies that the request will accept before automatically closing, null for unlimited replies
        messageHandlers - there is small chance that the request reply will arrive before a message handler is attached to the requests publication, so you can optionally add a message handler here.
        Returns:
        a Request instance associated with the request.
